____________________TAP TO PLAY_____________ Welcome to Comfort Reader! Before you begin, here are some tips. 
 ———READING——— 
To start and pause reading, tap in the middle of the screen. To skip backward, tap the left side of the screen. To skip forward, tap the right side. Keep your finger pressed a little bit longer to skip longer text at once.
———SETTINGS———
To go to the settings, pause and tap on the gearwheel icon in the upper left corner.
In the settings, you can adjust your reading speed and the size of the text chunks. An average person reads 200-250 words per minute. Over time, you may become faster as Comfort Reader is designed to reduce visual stress. You can also modify your position and change the appearance of the text. Choose a typeface that fits your style. Comfort Reader supports Sans, Serif, Mono and OpenDyslexic and various colors.
———LOAD A TEXT———
There are 4 ways to load a text.
1) In the settings, you can import a "txt", "pdf" or "epub" file that resides on the internal memory of your device.
2) Open the settings menu. Paste and edit your text manually.
3) Start a third party file manager of your choice. Search and select your "txt", "pdf" or "epub" file. Then choose 'Read with Comfort Reader'.
4) Open a website or a wikipedia article in your browser. Use the "share" option of your browser and select "Comfort Reader". A text version of the website will show up in Comfort Reader.
———NOTES———
On the upper right, tap on the "pen" icon and add a note. A note contains your comment and the text passage you are currently commenting on.
For each book, Comfort Reader saves your notes in a separate text file within the "Comfort Reader" directory inside your internal memory. In case you don't need to comment and just want to add an interesting part of text to your notes, keep your finger pressed in the middle of the screen.———EXTRA TIPS———
Use the volume buttons to pause and fine-tune reading speed. Volume down means +1 wpm while you read. When you are paused, it means -1 wpm. Make use of your peripheral vision: keep "Review and Preview" switched on in your settings. Many people use Comfort Reader to reduce eye fatigue. They prefer light text on dark background and wider fonts like OpenDyslexia. 
———— Thank you for your time! Enjoy your reading! —————
